Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Tuesday March 4), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script: i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for tuesday, march 4th. microsoft has announced a significant expansion in its partnership with openai, pledging an additional $10 billion investment to strengthen its ai capabilities. this comes as microsoft aims to enhance its azure openai service, integrating advanced language models such as gpt-4 into its offerings, reaffirming its commitment to advancing ai technology. meanwhile, google is responding to the rise of ai assistants by unveiling bard, its new ai-powered conversational tool. ceo sundar pichai highlighted bard's potential to revolutionize how users interact with technology by providing more natural, intuitive responses. this move underscores google's strategy to maintain its leadership position in the competitive ai landscape. over in the social media domain, tiktok is rolling out new features aimed at bolstering user privacy and security, particularly targeting its younger demographic. these updates include enhanced content moderation tools and more robust privacy settings, reflecting tiktok's effort to address growing concerns around data privacy and user safety. that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script: "i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for tuesday, march 4th. microsoft is making headlines with a major boost to its partnership with openai, committing an additional $10 billion investment to enhance its ai capabilities. this investment aims to upgrade microsoft's azure openai service by integrating cutting-edge language models like gpt-4, solidifying microsoft's position as a leader in ai innovation. meanwhile, over at google, the tech giant is rolling out its latest conversational ai tool—bard. ceo sundar pichai highlighted bard's potential to transform user interactions with technology by delivering more natural and intuitive responses. this move is part of google's strategy to maintain its competitive edge in the ever-evolving ai landscape. shifting gears to social media, tiktok is introducing new features designed to strengthen user privacy and security, with a particular focus on its younger audience. these updates include improved content moderation and enhanced privacy settings, addressing growing concerns about data protection and user safety. that's all for today's briefing. we'll see you back here tomorrow."
Podcast Title: EP-229 Microsoft's $10b Openai Partnership Boost 💰, Google's Bard Ai Launch 📡, Tiktok's Privacy Push 🔒
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for tuesday, march 4th! delve into today's top tech topics:

  • microsoft's ai investment: microsoft commits an additional $10 billion to its partnership with openai, aiming to upgrade azure openai service and integrate language models like gpt-4, strengthening its ai leadership.
  • google's bard: ceo sundar pichai unveils bard, a new conversational ai tool designed to enhance user interactions with more natural responses, as google continues to compete in the ai market.
  • tiktok's privacy updates: new features focusing on user privacy and security for younger audiences, including better content moderation and enhanced settings, address data protection concerns.

stay tuned for tomorrow's updates!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image set in a futuristic, tech-driven cityscape at dawn, where the silhouettes of skyscrapers are lit by the first light of day. central to the scene is a sleek, advanced satellite gently orbiting above, symbolizing the interconnectedness of global technologies. below, a vibrant digital display on the side of a skyscraper projects a holographic representation of an ai brain, signifying microsoft’s openai partnership. in the foreground, a transparent digital sphere encases a map of the world with small, glowing nodes connected by arcs, representing tiktok's privacy push. interwoven throughout the image are subtle beams of light and networks of binary code flowing like rivers between these elements, emphasizing innovation and interconnectivity. the atmosphere of the image is one of dynamic movement and synergy, capturing the essence of modern technological advancements
